8.5. Ads Layout/Special Placements Visual

  


Requirements

The Ads Layout/Special Placements Visual feature is an optional addition. There are two main options for this: 

  


Option 1: The Ads Layout/Special Placements Visual would provide a PDF or Word document printout that shows a basic visual layout template for ads with Special Placement. This would show the publication date and page number, with a grid layout like the grid in Configure Publication. 

  


Each grid cell that has been assigned to an ad would show basic information about the ad: 

  * Customer 
  * Ad Title
  * Ad Size
  * Ad Color



  


The following is an example of what a page might look like with a quarter page ad placed in the top left: 

![](data:image/png;base64,)

  


  


Option 2: The Ads Layout/Special Placements Visual would be a multipane report: 

  


The left pane would be a list of page numbers for the selected publication (based off of which page numbers have been entered in "Special Placement Page Number" and "Index Page Number" for the selected Publication Date). 

  


The right side of the report would be 8 separate small panes, one for each cell on the layout grid. Each of these would fill with the corresponding information for ads that have been placed, providing a basic visual layout template for ads with Special Placement. This would show the publication date and page number, with a grid layout like the grid in Configure Publication. 

  


Each grid cell that has been assigned to an ad would show basic information about the ad: 

  * Customer 
  * Ad Title
  * Ad Size
  * Ad Color



  


This would be viewed within the software rather than opening the PDF on another tab or opening a Word doc. 

  


The following is an example of what a report page might look like with a quarter page ad placed in the top left: 

![](data:image/png;base64,)

  


Development Specification

We could do a Word merge that would show a text layout (Customer, Ad Title, etc.).
